item.title: UN Agency Alert for Radioactive Escape Risks in the conflict between Israel and Iran
item.description: The director of the Atomic International Energy Agency (AIEA), Rafael Grossi, warned yesterday to the risk of radio leakage due to Israelite attacks against Iranian nuclear facilities and offered to travel to the region. Despite the warning, the AIEA has assured that it has not detected any radioactive escapes since Israel launched the offensive against Iran on Friday. Grossi reported yesterday the Board of Governors of AIEA that the UN agency based in Vienna follows the situation closely since the beginning of the conflict. He said the AIEA Crisis Center is working 24 hours a day to evaluate the radiation level in the main Iranian facilities. The goal is to be able to respond to any emergency within one hour, he explained, according to the Spanish news agency Europa Press. "Military climb threatens lives, increases the possibility of radiological escape with serious consequences for the population and the environment and delays the indispensable work for a long -term diplomatic solution that Iran will not get a nuclear weapon," he said. Maximum containment In the intervention before the Council of Governors of the AIEA, the Argentine diplomat at the head of the agency since December 2019 also appealed to the “maximum containment” of “all parties”. He also appealed to all AIEA member countries to collaborate in an approximation between the parties. He said he was ready to “travel as soon as possible to evaluate the situation and ensure safety and non-village” in Iran. Regarding the situation of recent days, marked by “complicated and complex circumstances”, Grossi praised the exchange of information between the IAEA and the Iranian authorities. The exchange of information is essential that the international community is aware of what is going on on the ground and can provide “health care” in an emergency, he said. Grossi promised that the AIAE “will not be on the sidelines” of the conflict, the second in three years between two member countries of the organization that have nuclear facilities, as has been the case since 2022 in the case of Russia and Ukraine.

item.title: Health | Doctors trained in a vain being able to exercise in Portugal
item.description:
Doctors trained at the future medical school of the University of Macau, from 2028, will also be able to exercise in Portugal. Courses at a vain operate in co-tutela, which ensures that students graduated from the University of Macao get equivalence and recognition of the Portuguese University
Licenses at the future medical school of the University of Macau (one), from 2028, will be able to exercise in Portugal, yesterday told Lusa a manager of the University of Lisbon (Ulisboa). The Ulisboa Medical School is collaborating with one to create a curriculum with a structure “close to what is the structure” of the courses at the Portuguese institution, said the director of the institution. Luís Graça explained that the courses will work in co-tutela, allowing doctors graduated from a “equivalence and recognition” by the Ulisboa School of Medicine. Among the advantages will be the possibility of “doctors trained there in the territory [Macau] can also exercise medicine in Portugal”, stressed the investigator. In December, Uma Vice Rector Rui Martins said Ulisboa will help create the first public medical school in Macao, on the institution's new campus, in neighboring Hengqin (Mountain Island). The University of Science and Technology of Macao, a private institution, has since 2008 has been a Faculty of Health Sciences, officially renamed as Medicine Faculty in 2019. In an interview with the Portuguese Local Public Television Channel TDM, Martins said Medicine will be one of four new colleges to be born on the new Uma Campus in Hengqin. "We will have a Faculty of Information Sciences, a Faculty of Engineering, with new types of engineering, as well as a design faculty and should include architecture," said the Portuguese academic. "The idea in this campus is terms 'dual degrees' [courses in co-tutela] with foreign universities. Medicine is already with Lisbon and now we are defining for other colleges," added Martins. Hand in hand The new Campus in Hengqin, whose first stone was launched on December 9, will be inaugurated in 2028 and allows a passing 15,000 to a maximum of 25,000 students, stressed the Vice Rector for global affairs. Luís Graça, a transplant immunology expert, also demonstrated enthusiasm with potential collaborations between the two universities in the area of ​​scientific research. "If we think in terms of science, the reinforcement of the scientific potential of both institutions with a collaboration close to each other is something that will clearly benefit both sides of this partnership," said the leader. Graça said that the Ulisboa School of Medicine is organizing the first symposium to bring together the investigators of the institution and UM, with a view to promoting joint research projects. The college has had “occasional collaborations of researchers with researchers from other Chinese universities” as “it is important to proximity to places where excellent science is made and teaching excellence,” said the director. But Graça added that collaboration with one is "more institutional ... and can allow even greater reinforcement of these partnerships."

item.title: Medium-Earient | Five countries dismissed from visa in Macau
item.description:
Saudi Arabia national citizens, Qatar, Kuwait, Barizer and Oman are dismissed from a visa to enter Macao yesterday announced authorities, who are trying to attract more international visitors. The measure comes into force from 16 July
The Chief Executive signed an order that determines the dismissal of visa and entry to Macao to nationals from five Middle East countries. "Visa and prior authorization of entry in the Special Administrative Region of Macao of Macau, the national kingdom of Saudi, Qatar State, Kuwait, Barém Kingdom and Sultanato de Oman, are exempt from the Special Administrative Region of Arabia, reads in the order published yesterday in the official bulletin. The measure, which comes into force on July 16, comes at a time when the Macao government wants to attract more international visitors and after the territory's authorities and tour operators visited in February Saudi Arabia and Dubai to promote cooperation. The Directorate of Tourism Services launched, on this occasion, “a Macao Tour Guide to Muslims, with dissemination of 'halal' options [namely in food, in accordance with Islamic law],” the STD said in a statement. “The guide presents the aspects to take into account during the stay in Macao, gastronomic culture, itinerary recommendations, among other useful information for Muslim visitors,” reads the note. Flexible boundaries In order to facilitate the entry of visitors from other geographies outside China, the Secretary for Security announced, at the end of April, plans to accelerate border control through the use of automatic electronic channels. During the presentation of the political program for 2025, Wong Sio Chak stated that the territory will extend the use of automatic passage points to foreign citizens without resident or work authorization. To facilitate “exterior exchanges”, authorities will expand autoservice equipment to the biometric data collection system, which will apply to all foreign visitors, the leader explained. To the deputies at the Legislative Assembly, the secretary added that the government will continue to optimize iris recognition technology in border controls and study the extension to non-residents by 2025. According to official data, Macau received last year 34.9 million visitors, 23.8 percent than the previous year, but only 2.42 million (6.9 percent) were international tourists. The bulk of visitors - 70.1 percent - arrived from the interior of China, with another 20.6 percent being from Hong Kong and 2.4 percent of Taiwan.

item.title: Satellite Casinos | Sam hu fai reitera what impact will be reduced
item.description:
The chief executive is not concerned with the impact of closing the satellite casinos on the MSar GDP. In addition, it ensures that the government will closely follow the work situation of workers in these spaces and prepare an action plan to safeguard trade in the areas of these casinos, especially in NAPE
Sam Hou Fai is quiet about the impact that the end of the satellite casinos can have on the territory economy, GDP and employment level. After participating on Sunday at the Honorary Academic Degree Grant Ceremony 2025 of the University of Macao, the Chief Executive addressed some of the topics that dominate the political agenda of the MSAR. In a statement issued by the Social Communication Office on Sunday night, it is indicated that “the most important is the government to address the issue” of satellite casinos “with the aim of ensuring the legal, healthy and orderly development of the game sector”. "As for GDP I do not have very detailed data. I read some investigations analyzes and articles in the average Hong Kong. I do not remember if it was last year or 2023, the satellite casinos had revenues of just over ten billion patacas. Last year's GDP was 400 billion patacas, so the satellite casinos revenues occupy a very small proportion. The Chief Executive, quoted by the Macau channel of TDM. Regarding the future of the workers of these spaces, Sam Hou Fai reiterated that it was requested from the game dealers who are properly dealing with employee job placement and ensure their continuity. Returning to put the workforce of the satellite casinos in about 5,600 local employees, Sam Hou Fai indicated that close to 4,800 are hired by the game dealers and that as regards the placement of the remaining 800 “the principle of 'the contractor will be responsible' will be responsible for ensuring employment. The first responsibility should focus on the owners of the satellite casinos, to those who are requested to transform the“ companies that transform the “companies Subordinates in jobs. ”If they are not in a position that can guarantee the use of residents, the responsibility will pass to the concessionaires. Hole in the middle of the city The chief executive said that his government will rigorously supervise the way concessionaires will assume their responsibilities. But the government will also prepare and plan joint action policies for community development in the Nape zone and its surroundings, ”to support commercial establishments that survive thanks to the proximity of these places of play that will disappear. The ruler stressed that the executive's priority is to stabilize the employment sector. To this end, it stressed the creation of the Working Group for the coordination of Employment Promotion to “coordinate inter-service resources and fully boost the work guarantee work of local residents”.

item.title: Elections | Confirmed exclusion from the list of mutual grassroots aid
item.description:
The 14 seats in the Legislative Assembly chosen by direct suffrage will be discussed by eight lists, the lowest number ever on the MSAR. Caeal considers that authorities' operations against the potential list of Wong Wai Man took place within the attributed skills, but refuses to comment on electoral interference
Legislative elections with fewer lists to participate in direct suffrage since the creation of the MSAR. This is the reality of the elections of September 14, confirmed yesterday by the Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal), and the number of lists can still shrink, depending on any vetoes of candidates by the State Security Defense Commission. According to Caeal, eight candidacy commissions were approved in the direct suffrage that have to deliver until Thursday next week (June 26) the list of candidates and the political program. CAEAL has confirmed that the list application commission helps Mutual Grassroots, linked to the “MAO Soldier”, did not gather the signatures necessary to be constituted and participate in the elections. However, the president of Caeal, Judge Seng Ioi Man, refused to confirm that the list was aimed at an operation of the Commissioner Against Corruption (CCAC) for corruption in the collection of signatures due to "the secrecy of justice." Members of the Potential List Association Association Mutual Help Grassroots were targeted by two police operations last week when they tried to gather the missing signatures to participate in the elections. After delivering the required signatures, Caeal, at first, refused several signatures because they considered that they were duplicated or did not meet legal requirements. Given the invalid signatures, the potential list had an extra five business days to correct the failures. However, over the time, it was the target of two authorities' operations. The first operation aimed at the most media member and head-to-head in 2017 for mutual aid Grassroots, Wong Wai Man, also known as “Soldier of Mao” and “Captain of Macao”. Wong is indicted for illegally exploiting a Mahjong space. The day after the first operation, other members of the association were the target of a CCAC Rusga, for alleged corruption in the subscription collection. Both operations will have left the list without the possibility of submitting the new signatures. Within skills Asked about the impact of authorities' operations on subscription collection aid mutual grassroots and a possible interference in the elections, Seng Ioi Man refused to make any association of police operations with the list. However, he argued that the police action took place within the legally foreseen competences: “Regarding the follow -up work and investigative operations that the police or investigative bodies are performing, our commission will not comment,” began by answering Seng Ioi Man. “Police bodies do their work within their competences and only within these skills receive complaints and do the work. He added. Regarding the fact that the electoral act only has eight lists, and there is a possibility of exclusions by the State Security Defense Commission, the president of Caeal replied that the work was done in accordance with the legislation in force and that guarantee the principle “Macao governed by patriots”. Seng Ioi Man also pointed out that the deputies who were elected have to "love Macau and love our country." Falling lists The eight approved candidacy committees are: Union for Development (linked to the Association of Workers), Promoting Union for Progress (Association of Residents), Macao United Citizens Association (Fujian Community), Synergy Power (Ron Lam), Bom Lar's Alliance (Association of Women), Macau-Guangdong Community (Jiangmen Community) from popular Liveliod in Macau. Only this last commission is not linked to any elected deputy. This year's elections thus contrast with previous years, since for the first time there are less than 10 candidate lists in direct suffrage. Until this edition, the lowest participation had happened in 2001, the first elections after the establishment of the MSAR, when there was a total of 15 lists. At the opposite pole, 2017 was the most participating with 25 lists, a number that fell to 14 lists in 2021, in the first year there was a political exclusion of candidates. After presenting the list of candidates and political programs, the lists still need to go through the political sieve of the State Security Defense Commission. Regarding the indirect suffrage six candidacy commissions were approved.

item.title: Commerce | CUPPA Coffee manager calls for support to Portuguese companies
item.description:
The story of Cuppa Coffee dates back to 2008 when it was hard to find a space in Macau to drink good coffee. The location in the old mud brought fame to the project, but the space ended up closing doors and moving to Studio City. João Incarnation, who manages coffee, speaks of the news and the importance of supporting Lusophone matrix projects
It all started in the mind of Portuguese Cristiana Figueiredo, at a time when for a Portuguese or passionate about coffee living in Macau it was hard to find a space to enjoy this drink accompanied by bakery or pastry products, in good Portuguese way. Cristiana Figueiredo said, in an interview with the Macao Commerce and Investment Promotion Institute (Ipim), which led her to invest in this type of business. "In Europe, people have a habit to go to coffee and to work for work. When I came to Macau for over 20 years, I realized that the Portuguese coffee culture is not popular in Macao, so I was born the idea of ​​opening a coffee in Macao, hoping to promote the food and culture of Portuguese coffee." Since 2008, Cuppa Coffee, associated with the initial project of the businesswoman, Nata Bakery, founded in 2007 and focused on bakery and pastry products, has become one of the favorite spaces of the Portuguese, foreign and even resident of the territory. However, the direction of the economic environment, with greater difficulties in paying lace, has dictated some transformations to the project, which now ends doors to the entrance of Taipa Velha and also with Lakes Nam Van, to be only in the Studio City venture in Cotai. The closure in the lakes Nam Van took place in January. At HM, João Incarnation, director and shareholder of the company that generates Cuppa Coffee, explains that, in fact, the change to the Cotai was decided for a long time. "I often say that there was no change to Studio City, because this was a plan that already existed and that came regardless of the taipa store closure. We would always open this space regardless of whether we continue, or not, with the store in the mud, whose closure was due to a failed negotiation regarding space income." According to João Incarnation, who today generates the company with Nicole Massa Helm, both considered that "in the current economic situation there was no conditions to continue in that space, which is relatively large and had its costs." "We needed to contain if we wanted the business to continue to work, because the alternative is always to close completely. We did not give up on the idea of ​​opening anything in the mud and being a little closer to our regular and more faithful customers, so we continue to open another establishment in the mud that can serve customers who live there. Therefore, there is no proper trip to Stadio City," João said, " Incarnation. The director and shareholder understands that this change always causes some nostalgia. “We pity it to have closed it. It cost us, we really have a lot of pity,” he confessed. "It was a decision that could have been made longer, at least a year, but we still tried to keep the establishment there, but we were not possible. We will see what the future reserves us." Despite these changes, Cuppa Coffee can be considered a success case. "It worked there for many years and it worked well. This is a business that has to have certain conditions to work because, as we know, it has a lot of movement, but with little performance regarding each client. It is a business that needs many customers to support themselves, and for many years, at the level of rent values ​​and everything else, suppliers for example, it was much cheaper and things worked better," he recalls. The location in Taipa Velha gave Cuppa Coffee “a very large recognition and clientele”, despite the growing difficulties. "As prices were increasing, we also needed to increase our prices, but never in proportion to the increase in expenses. There was a time when we could not continue," he assumed. What the future reserves João Incarnation ensures that what customers have always sought in this space will continue in Studio City: good coffee and pastry products, with the presence of Portugal. "We always try to introduce new products. We created a new, coffee and coconut -based drink, which is excellent. We also introduced the" Nata Bomb ", a Milkshake Beat Concept flavored Nata, a true bomb," he described. There are also “traditional Portuguese products that did not exist before, such as bay bread”, as well as the donuts with different flavors, “to complete the offer we have”. "Our offer is already so varied that, even without introducing more products, it is sufficient to satisfy the values ​​of Portuguese customers and others as well." John Incarnation also said that the change of establishment to Studio City was born from an invitation. “We don't know how to run yet, it's a bet that we are making right now”, and the goal is always to go back to street coffee. "The concept of having a neighborhood store or on the street is something that interests us a lot and we are already seeing other possibilities," he added. "I don't have enough data to tell you that the change to Studio City is a winning bet. It's different, just like the concept, and we will have another type of customers beyond the usual." A “Heart” project Looking back, John Incarnation says that, for example, major problems have never been registered with human resources. "To this day we do not feel the big problem with lack of labor, it has never been something that has greatly affected us. Nowadays it is not as easy as it used to have quotas [for non-resident workers], as there are enough places that need placement. It is able to be easier, at this time, to get more local workers than before," he said, confirming that lace remain to be the big problem for such business. “Cuppa Coffee is a project of the heart and during the pandemic I realized that I was going to close. I also realized that there was a series of closures, almost simultaneously, from other Portuguese establishments. Talk to my partner, who has a lot of experience in this area, and told him that I liked to try to keep Cuppa Coffee open. Possible to continue exactly the same concept and the same quality as it had been having with Cristiana, who did an excellent work in the creation and growth of Cuppa Coffee. ” Overcoming the pandemic years, and at a time when Macau faces a break in local consumption, João Incarnation says that "it fulfills a bit to the Portuguese community to make the possible to support the effort we do so that everything is still open." "I am not just talking about Cuppa Coffee, but also from wheat d'Ouro, butteria, Portuguese restaurants and Lord Stow, which is not a typical Portuguese business is based on Portuguese culture. All these businesses have to be fed and supported. For our part, we must maintain quality, but the Portuguese community has to take advantage of what exists and support the Portuguese business." Despite the breach of consumption by the places, João Incarnation says that a balance with the consumption of tourists is guaranteed. "We feel a little [Break of consumption], but we can counterbalance with the offers we make and that satisfy the taste of local Chinese and visitors. But of course [Breaking of Consumption] has, of course, impact on business, not just the Portuguese, and this is in the city. But I think there is still some critical mass to keep Portuguese business open," he said.

item.title: Photography | Jorge Veiga Alves Pictures Celebrate Macau in Lisbon
item.description:
The Macao House in Lisbon presents, next Monday, 23, the photo project “Looking for Macau”, by Jorge Veiga Alves, former resident of Macau and amateur photographer. The main objective of this event is to celebrate the day of Macao and the houses of Macao, a date set on the calendar on June 24
June is the month to celebrate Macau and his patron saint, St. John the Baptist, namely on June 24, known as City Day, celebrating the victory over the Dutch in 1622 at the Battle of Macao. It is like this, in a month already very hot and based on the popular saints that is celebrated the tradition and history of Macao, something also done this year by the Macao House in Lisbon, this time using photography. item.title: Latin America | Beijing requires US to stop interfering with internal affairs
item.description: China has demanded yesterday from the United States to stop “interfering with internal affairs in other countries,” after the US embassy in Panama announces that it will replace 13 Chinese telecommunications equipment Huawei in that country. "The United States government has long been conducted surveillance and cybership in Latin America and Caribbean, which has had a negative impact on the western hemisphere and has had insecurity in the countries of the American continent," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun said at a press conference. Guo stressed that "China has always supported the Latin American and Caribbean countries, including Panama, defends independence and opposes hegemony, intimidation and external interference." "Beijing has never sought spheres of influence, nor was he involved in geopolitical competitions, nor coerced other countries to take sides," he said, adding that Latin America "is not anyone's backyard." The spokesman also asked Washington to "stop politicizing economic, commercial and technological affairs, to interfere with the internal affairs of other countries and to undermine their sovereignty and independence." China's Ministry of Foreign Ministry statements come after Panama President José Raúl Mulino required last week to the United States and to refrain from dragging the country to the “geopolitical conflict” between Washington and Beijing. The reaction of the Panamian head of state followed the announcement made by the US embassy in Panama, which stated that the government led by Donald Trump will replace, “with safe US technology”, 13 Huawei equipment under a campaign to “counteract China's evil influence” in the region.

item.title: Kidnapping | Announced detention of three people
item.description: Three members of an illegal money exchange group were arrested by the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP), after kidnapping two people. The case was reported yesterday by the authorities and quoted by the newspaper or Mun. According to the information released, at the source of the crime was an illegal money exchange that ran ill between two groups. At first, the group with three members agreed to exchange money with another group. The three members were thus receiving a bank transfer in an interior account. However, the other group used money with unknown origin in this bank transfer, which led to the funds to be frozen, resulting in a loss of 94,500 Renminbis to the three detainees. Dissatisfied, the group of the three detainees combined a new but in -person money exchange. As soon as the other group sent two people to a hotel room, where the exchange should happen, the three detainees left for violence and kidnapping. When the kidnappeds had the opportunity to contact the group to which they belonged, initially to request the return of 94,500 Renminbis, they took the opportunity to ask for help. In turn, the group of kidnappeds contacted the authorities. According to the investigation by the Judicial Police (PJ), the suspects began to devote themselves to the illegal exchange of money in February this year. However, they refused to cooperate with the PJ. Authorities still pursue a suspect. The case was referred to the prosecutor, and the members concerned are indicted for the practice of exploitation of illicit exchange rate for play, kidnapping, simple offense to physical integrity, damage and threat.

item.title: Entrepreneurship | Event for local companies wants to capture “angel investors”
item.description:
Macau today hosts an event designed to capture the so -called “angel investors” for local entrepreneurship projects. Macao Angel Investor Network takes place at “The Macao Young Entrepreneur Incubation Center” and aims to support emerging business projects or simply startups that are taking the first steps
It's called “Macau Angel Investor Network”, anything like “Angel Investor Network in Macao” and aims to bring residents closer who want to be successful entrepreneurs and create their own business in an economy that wants to diverse. The event is scheduled for today at Hengqin Development Center, at 517 Avenida da Praia Grande, Nam Tung commercial building, between 11h and 12h30, and has several personalities linked to the local economy, but not only. They are Raphael Chan, Deputy Director of the Directorate of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT), Paulo Andrez, Emeritus President of the “European Business Angel Network” and also figures such as Emanuel Soares, Legal Consultant, U Man Fai, angel investor for the Great Bay and Founder/founder of “Esenia Fund” and even Ung Choi Kun, former deputy to the Legislative Assembly and president of Kun Cheong Holding Ltd and also an “angel investor”. The event is developed by the Association for Entrepreneurship and Innovation for Macao, China and Portuguese -speaking countries, which is linked Marco Duarte Rizzolio. To HM, this explained the main objectives that are behind this initiative. "We want to connect an angel investors to startups and small and medium enterprises (SMEs), fostering the entrepreneurial ecosystem and promoting the economic diversification of Macao." In turn, Alvin Fong, also linked to the organization of this event and president of Direch International, argued that it is intended to “create a platform that brings together knowledge about angel investments, helping in the diversification of Macao's economy”. According to Rizzolio, "Investors Angel, who invest capital in emerging companies, are fundamental to support startups in early stages where financing possibilities are more scarce in the traditional financial sector." “In addition,” he said, the contact network that now runs on Praia Grande Avenue “seeks to bring investors closer to Portuguese -speaking and China countries, creating mutual access to the best projects developed in these regions and reinforcing Macao as a strategic link between the East and the West”. For Alvin Fong, this is the "opportune moment" for the holding of such an event, given that "the world is going through many changes and new opportunities are emerging." According to Marco Duarte Rizzolio, in Macao have already occurred in previous events in an attempt to capture angel investments, "but this is the first time a" Business Angels "network has been created in Macao with Chinese investors and Portuguese -speaking countries." "The conditions to hold this event now arise from various factors, such as the accelerated growth of innovation and technology, the greater digitization and the use of software in business, the need to diversify the local economy, the growing focus on the great bay as a pole of innovation," he said. At issue, there are also factors such as “the joint effort of public and private entities in creating an environment favorable to entrepreneurship”, something that has been greatly enhanced by the pandemic years, defended, having brought Macao and the authorities “a new understanding of the importance of supporting local and regional businesses, making this moment particularly strategic”. Who is who For today's session were invited “Successful Entrepreneurs and Entrepreneurs, some of whom are leaders in their areas”, and their “experience and intelligence add a lot to this event,” said Alvin Fong. Already Marco Duarte Rizzolio, stressed that will be present “people interested in technology and innovation, including some angel investors, representatives of risk capital funds, renowned entrepreneurs and specialists in innovation and business development”. Today's session is an “opportunity to obtain valuable knowledge and expand the network of contacts”, and Marco Duarte Rizzolio highlights personalities such as Paulo Andrez, “recognized international expert in entrepreneurship, innovation and angel investment”, or Ung Choi Kun, “prominent figure in Macao in real estate and education sectors, as well as an angel investor in several companies”. Asked about the main areas in which this initiative is focused on, Rizzolio adds that the event is focused on “startups and SMEs that act on sectors such as technology, intelligent tourism, green economy, health, digital education, logistics or finance”, because they are “sectors with high growth potential and that are aligned in local needs”, namely in the “1+” economic diversification strategy or “1+4” strategy global trends ”. "We want to identify innovative companies that can thrive not only in Macao, but also in the big bay and in international markets," added this official who is also linked to the organization of the startups and entrepreneurship contest, the "929 Challenge". Right moment For Alvin Fong, Macao currently presents potentialities for the connection of business projects to the cities of the Great Bay, all located in Guangdong Province. "Macau has a lot of freedom and flexibility to experience new ideas. In addition, we have received many tourists from around the world. Being one of GBA's eleven cities, Macau is, in fact, an excellent platform," he said. In turn, Marco Duarte Rizzolio speaks of “unique characteristics” of the territory, “like their position as a bridge between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, a stable regulatory environment and tax and financial incentives that can attract investors and startups”. There is also “the increase in the focus on the diversification of the economy beyond the game sector”, with “a fertile ground for innovation and new business”. "In a global scenario of low interest rates, capital markets with some geopolitical friction, investment in technology has presented multiple incomparable from other assets. In this context, the creation of more financial incentives and the strengthening of startup support programs are crucial steps," said the event co-creator. Great competition Despite the potential, the challenges persist, given that “Macao does not have many advantages beyond the game sector,” there is “intense competition in the big bay,” warned Alvin Fong. For Marco Duarte Rizzolio "Challenges are significant," because "the transition from an economy so dependent on the game sector to a more diverse model takes time and requires coordinated efforts." It is also necessary to take into account the opportunities that arise with the integration of MSar on Hengqin Island, Rizzoolio said, which recalls, however, “the challenges related to competitiveness and regulatory adaptation”. "In addition, housing and commercial remodeling requires balance between economic growth and the preservation of local social fabric. It is essential to create policies that encourage entrepreneurship and investment, minimizing the negative impacts of these transformations," he said. Asked whether the authorities have been enough to capture angel investors, both argue that there is more work to do. "This is a good start, but more can be done in the future," said Alvin Fong. Already Marco Duarte Rizzolio, said that "the Government of MSAR has made important efforts", as well as mentioning "several times the need to create a" Business Angels "network." “Macau has supported many initiatives that aim to stimulate investment. It is true that the creation of more financial incentives and the strengthening of startup support programs are crucial steps. It is also necessary to promote Macau more actively as an attractive destination for investors, highlighting its competitive advantages on the international scene. This event is an example of good collaboration between the public and private sector to stimulate ecosystem”, defended Rizzolio. Also noteworthy is that today's close connection with 369, an entity that aims to become “an international hub of science and technology in Macau, giving new generations a greater stage of exploration” of opportunities, ”said Alvin Fong, president of this entity. Marco Duarte Rizzolio stressed that we are facing “an incubator of the Macao ecosystem that has organized several events”.

item.title: June 10 | Alexandre Leitão highlights the end of the waiting lists at the Consulate
item.description:

Alexandre Leitão, Consul, highlighted the end of the waiting lists in the consulate and the modernization of some services, noting that Portugal is ready to promote stronger economic ties with the MSAR

Portugal with value Thus, the official said he could “safely say that the essential, from the strictly consular point of view, is done”, but intends to bet on the “deepening of Portugal's diplomatic, economic and cultural relations with the special administrative regions” of Macao and Hong Kong. item.title: Satellite Casinos | Government says that closing impact will be controlled
item.description:
It is official: the 11 satellite casinos will even end doors until December 31 this year, and Melco and the Macao Game Society have already announced the restructuring plans. Regarding the affected workers, the government presents numbers lower than those already mentioned by deputies and associations: 5,600. An impact on SMEs is still expected, but without a major consequence for banks
After much speculation, here is finally the authorities and operators have announced what will actually happen to the 11 satellite casinos operated in the territory. They all will close, and the Macau Game Society (SJM) Resorts and Melco have already defined the plans for what follows [see secondary text], which includes acquisitions of L'ARC and Bridge 16, as well as the transfer of workers and game machines. The executive presented yesterday, at a press conference, numbers of workers affected with the closing of the satellite casinos below those already referred to by sector associations. It will be, after all, 5,600 and no more than ten thousand as some deputies said to these entities, and from this cake, 4,800 workers were directly hired by the game operators, so, if the satellite casino close, they can be integrated into their tables. The rest, 800, were contracted directly by the satellite casinos themselves. There are still 400 non -resident workers (TNR) involved in this process. With regard to Mocha Clubs, 300 local workers and 50 TNR. Tai Kin IP, secretary for the economy and finance, said that "the data were collected by different means", but that the government calculations "are official". "As the other means came to this data, I don't know," he added. Asked about the support of these 800 workers, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, explained that "the owners of the satellite casinos have the responsibility to ensure the work relationship of these people." "In the case of the 4,800 hired by the dealers, such as Croupiers or Treasury employees, they can return to work in these dealers' casinos. In relation to 800, the concessionaires have guaranteed the government that if they have employment problems they can absorb them and provide adequate jobs on the properties of the dealers," he said. Representative Song Pek Kei even talked about the possibility of about 15,000 unemployed, while Nick Law, in a plenary intervention, said that among the satellite casinos and associated stores, there were "13,500 workers", representing "4.6 percent of the total macao work force". POSSIBILITY OF CONVERSION Regarding small and medium-sized companies (SMEs) located in the neighborhoods that will no longer have these satellite casinos, namely in areas such as the Inner Port, Zape, Nape or Fishermen's Dock, the government predicts some impact but controlled. There are, in total, 320 stores that operate in the vicinity with 800 workers, and “about 400 workers will have another employment situation according to the reconversion of stores,” said Secretary Tai Kin IP. Essentially, and after the government's surveys, half of the 320 stores "will be affected directly by the satellite casinos closure, such as the pledge houses, mobile phones, restaurants and jewelery." However, Tai Kin IP pointed out that there will be others that will not have a great impact on depending on sales to residents. Above all, the ruler pointed out that this scenario may even constitute an opportunity. "It will be a challenge and an opportunity for the reconversion of stores. Traditional stores that have a close relationship with satellite casinos customers have to counter. Highlight that Hospitality Consultant Savills referred in March that the satellite casinos closure would devalue the hotels in 60 percent and cause more non-compliance with the SMEs, with bank credit obligations valued between 25 and 39 billion. Tai Kin IP devalued this scenario. “From the knowledge we have, the loans granted to satellite casinos involve less than 1 percent of all bank loan activity, and we find that the risks are very limited to the operation of banks. In terms of risk supervision indicators in the financial industry, such as capital flow and others, banks' behavior will be safe and stable.” Regarding the SMEs, Tai Kin IP said that the monetary and currency of Macao is “closely monitoring the situation with the banks to mitigate the recovery of customers”, and the secretary in advance that in April, “ten billion patacas were injected to loans to the SMEs, attenuating their pressures”. Asked about the timing of these measures, André Cheong said it is the right time. "It all depends on the dealerships' decisions and we now officially receive the decision. This is a problem that has to do with several casinos and a considerable number of workers, and we did not want that only at the end of the year they knew about their situation. With six months to finish the transition period we understand that this is the indicated phase to advertise," he said. No impact on recipes Given the budgetary revision for this year with 12 billion Patacas in the forecast of game revenues, André Cheong assured that the satellite casinos closure will not have a major impact on the overview of revenues. "We made the budgetary review with less 12 billion patacas due to lack of consumption. We believe that the closure of satellite casinos does not have great impact on the game's recipes," he said. The secretary also stressed that, as for the intention of SJM Resorts to purchase the enterprises Ponte 16 and L'ARC, the concessionaire "has to conclude this acquisition procedure until December 31, and if they cannot buy these satellite casinos [who operate in the projects] have to end."

item.title: Commerce | CUPPA Coffee manager calls for support to Portuguese companies
item.description:
The story of Cuppa Coffee dates back to 2008 when it was hard to find a space in Macau to drink good coffee. The location in the old mud brought fame to the project, but the space ended up closing doors and moving to Studio City. João Incarnation, who manages coffee, speaks of the news and the importance of supporting Lusophone matrix projects
It all started in the mind of Portuguese Cristiana Figueiredo, at a time when for a Portuguese or passionate about coffee living in Macau it was hard to find a space to enjoy this drink accompanied by bakery or pastry products, in good Portuguese way. Cristiana Figueiredo said, in an interview with the Macao Commerce and Investment Promotion Institute (Ipim), which led her to invest in this type of business. "In Europe, people have a habit to go to coffee and to work for work. When I came to Macau for over 20 years, I realized that the Portuguese coffee culture is not popular in Macao, so I was born the idea of ​​opening a coffee in Macao, hoping to promote the food and culture of Portuguese coffee." Since 2008, Cuppa Coffee, associated with the initial project of the businesswoman, Nata Bakery, founded in 2007 and focused on bakery and pastry products, has become one of the favorite spaces of the Portuguese, foreign and even resident of the territory. However, the direction of the economic environment, with greater difficulties in paying lace, has dictated some transformations to the project, which now ends doors to the entrance of Taipa Velha and also with Lakes Nam Van, to be only in the Studio City venture in Cotai. The closure in the lakes Nam Van took place in January. At HM, João Incarnation, director and shareholder of the company that generates Cuppa Coffee, explains that, in fact, the change to the Cotai was decided for a long time. "I often say that there was no change to Studio City, because this was a plan that already existed and that came regardless of the taipa store closure. We would always open this space regardless of whether we continue, or not, with the store in the mud, whose closure was due to a failed negotiation regarding space income." According to João Incarnation, who today generates the company with Nicole Massa Helm, both considered that "in the current economic situation there was no conditions to continue in that space, which is relatively large and had its costs." "We needed to contain if we wanted the business to continue to work, because the alternative is always to close completely. We did not give up on the idea of ​​opening anything in the mud and being a little closer to our regular and more faithful customers, so we continue to open another establishment in the mud that can serve customers who live there. Therefore, there is no proper trip to Stadio City," João said, " Incarnation. The director and shareholder understands that this change always causes some nostalgia. “We pity it to have closed it. It cost us, we really have a lot of pity,” he confessed. "It was a decision that could have been made longer, at least a year, but we still tried to keep the establishment there, but we were not possible. We will see what the future reserves us." Despite these changes, Cuppa Coffee can be considered a success case. "It worked there for many years and it worked well. This is a business that has to have certain conditions to work because, as we know, it has a lot of movement, but with little performance regarding each client. It is a business that needs many customers to support themselves, and for many years, at the level of rent values ​​and everything else, suppliers for example, it was much cheaper and things worked better," he recalls. The location in Taipa Velha gave Cuppa Coffee “a very large recognition and clientele”, despite the growing difficulties. "As prices were increasing, we also needed to increase our prices, but never in proportion to the increase in expenses. There was a time when we could not continue," he assumed. What the future reserves João Incarnation ensures that what customers have always sought in this space will continue in Studio City: good coffee and pastry products, with the presence of Portugal. "We always try to introduce new products. We created a new, coffee and coconut -based drink, which is excellent. We also introduced the" Nata Bomb ", a Milkshake Beat Concept flavored Nata, a true bomb," he described. There are also “traditional Portuguese products that did not exist before, such as bay bread”, as well as the donuts with different flavors, “to complete the offer we have”. "Our offer is already so varied that, even without introducing more products, it is sufficient to satisfy the values ​​of Portuguese customers and others as well." John Incarnation also said that the change of establishment to Studio City was born from an invitation. “We don't know how to run yet, it's a bet that we are making right now”, and the goal is always to go back to street coffee. "The concept of having a neighborhood store or on the street is something that interests us a lot and we are already seeing other possibilities," he added. "I don't have enough data to tell you that the change to Studio City is a winning bet. It's different, just like the concept, and we will have another type of customers beyond the usual." A “Heart” project Looking back, John Incarnation says that, for example, major problems have never been registered with human resources. "To this day we do not feel the big problem with lack of labor, it has never been something that has greatly affected us. Nowadays it is not as easy as it used to have quotas [for non-resident workers], as there are enough places that need placement. It is able to be easier, at this time, to get more local workers than before," he said, confirming that lace remain to be the big problem for such business. “Cuppa Coffee is a project of the heart and during the pandemic I realized that I was going to close. I also realized that there was a series of closures, almost simultaneously, from other Portuguese establishments. Talk to my partner, who has a lot of experience in this area, and told him that I liked to try to keep Cuppa Coffee open. Possible to continue exactly the same concept and the same quality as it had been having with Cristiana, who did an excellent work in the creation and growth of Cuppa Coffee. ” Overcoming the pandemic years, and at a time when Macau faces a break in local consumption, João Incarnation says that "it fulfills a bit to the Portuguese community to make the possible to support the effort we do so that everything is still open." "I am not just talking about Cuppa Coffee, but also from wheat d'Ouro, butteria, Portuguese restaurants and Lord Stow, which is not a typical Portuguese business is based on Portuguese culture. All these businesses have to be fed and supported. For our part, we must maintain quality, but the Portuguese community has to take advantage of what exists and support the Portuguese business." Despite the breach of consumption by the places, João Incarnation says that a balance with the consumption of tourists is guaranteed. "We feel a little [Break of consumption], but we can counterbalance with the offers we make and that satisfy the taste of local Chinese and visitors. But of course [Breaking of Consumption] has, of course, impact on business, not just the Portuguese, and this is in the city. item.title: Pecunaries Checks | Former Beneficiaries defend better assignment criteria
item.description:

"I've never used this money for personal purposes, you know? But I think these changes are a good measure, justifiable, and I even think it's selfish, that I've been entitled to this support for so many years. There are other people who need it," he said. In the case of Maria João Ferreira, the cash of the pecuniary check was also used for expenses in Macao and with trips to the territory. "I have an account in Macao, and when I went there, if I needed to buy the plane ticket, my sister said the money here, or this money served to fund my stay in Macao," he explained. Sofia Mota, a permanent resident and former Maradora in Macao, regrets the absence of explanations for these changes. "It depends on what the pecuniary check is for, whether it is a way of distributing the wealth or profits of casinos to the people who are part of the territory, or have already done; either if it is a condition to be part of the territory. The teacher considers that "it makes no sense that those who contribute to social security at their own initiative, as is my case, are not covered." The article determines that "the residents of Macao are equal before the law, without discrimination due to nationality, ancestry, race, gender, language, religion, political or ideological convictions, economic instruction and situation or social condition." More recently, the Macao Synergy Association publicly stated that changes to the pecuniary reimbursement plan in economic development are not in accordance with the wishes of the population. Ron Lam also criticized the executive for applying the changes “in a hurry” which only came to cause more controversy: “the government was in a hurry and applied a sudden measure, without making any public consultation, with only behind -the -scenes movements leading to the population to question governance,” he said. item.title: Environment | Macau registers a new maximum temperatures in 2024
item.description:
The direction of environmental protection services yesterday launched new data on the environmental landscape in the territory, in the Macao Encounters of the Macao 2024. The data is not encouraging: last year a new record of maximum temperatures, more rain and typhoons were recorded. More electricity and water was spent, more garbage was produced and fewer recyclable waste was collected
Lusa The Government of Macao, through the Directorate of Environmental Protection Services (DSPA) announced yesterday that 2024 reached a maximum temperature record in the territory, and there was also an increase in typhoons and precipitation. According to the Macau 2024 state report, the average temperature last year was 23.6 ° C, precisely the value that had been reached in 2019, the highest since the records began, in 1952. The average temperature of 2024 was 0.8 ° C higher than the average climacteric (average of 30 years, between 1991 and 2020), according to the document prepared by DSPA. In addition, Macau registered 42 days considered to be hot last year, more 10.7 days than the climacteric average, 29 hot nights, more 17.5 than the average, and 29 cold days, less 10.1 days than the average. Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) classify as hot days when the maximum temperature is equal to or greater than 33ºC and the nights at which the minimum temperature is at least 28ºC. As for the days considered cold, they are those at which the minimum temperature does not exceed 12ºC. "With global warming, the occurrence of extreme weather phenomena is increasingly frequent," said DSPA in the report. In 2024, Macau was affected by seven tropical cyclones, known as tuffons, and for the first time three tropical cyclones affected Macao in November, the last month of the Typhoons, which begins in May. According to the report, the region last year received a total precipitation of 2,029.2 millimeters, "slightly higher than the climacteric average." DSPA also said that since 1970, sea level in Macao has risen at an average rate of about 3.5 millimeters per year. Also worldwide, 2024 was the hottest year that there are records and exceeded for the first time the 1.5 ° C above the pre-industrial level, in January the copernicus European service advanced in January. Last week, the world weather organization predicted that temperatures should continue to reach record values ​​by the end of the decade. More people, more expenses The DSPA report also tells that with the arrival of more tourists to Macau, there were also more waste and spending on water consumption, for example. "With the improvement of the economy, the number of visitors in 2024 increased 23.8 percent in annual terms for almost 35 million, having recovered about 90 percent of the pre-pound level. Tourist intensity also registered a certain increase, with GDP [Gross Domestic Product] climbed 8.8 percent. In addition, there was a slight increase in the population at the end of the year." Thus, it is added, "in relation to environmental indicators, economic and population growth led to the rise of estimated local emissions of greenhouse gases, invoiced water volume, electricity consumption and the amount of urban solid waste, compared to 2023". "During the pandemic, there was a decrease in the various economic and environmental indicators. However, with the constant improvement of the economy, most of these indicators rose again," is explained. With regard to the volume of invoiced water, in thousands of cubic meters, by 2023 the record was 89,164 and last year, 94.123, which constitutes an increase of 5.6 percent. Regarding electricity consumption, in millions of kW/h, in 2023 it was 5,740, while in 2024 consumption went to 6,030, plus 5.1 percent. The report also highlights the tons of urban solid waste produced, which in 2023 was 501,512, rising 5.1 percent last year to 526,979 tons. Another worrying fact of waste level was the fall, for the third consecutive year, the volume of recyclable waste collected, which went from 24.5 percent at 2021 to 21.7 percent last year. Changed for kids, of all recyclable waste generated in Macao, only about one fifth are collected for recycling. In the report, IP Kuong Lam, director of DSPA, indicates that last year, "with the ongoing economic recovery, there was greater pressure on various environmental indicators, while climate change became more severe." Despite the results, the official said that the objectives are "to encourage greater participation of the population in environmental initiatives and together to achieve the view of building a macao with low carbon emissions." A question of gases The report released yesterday by DSPA also accounts for the panorama of greenhouse gases (GHG) gases, and last year, a global increase of “about ten percent, including carbon dioxide (C02), which represented 90 percent”. It also highlights DSPA that “the estimated emissions of GHE from the various sources have registered upon the same period (2023), except for landfill residues, and the most significant increases were verified in estimated emissions from local electricity production and air transport”. In addition, it is stated that, in 2024, the main source of Emission of GHG and CO2 was land transport, followed by local electricity production, waste incineration, trade, domestic consumption and services. "The main sources of CH4 emissions [methane] were the waste deposited in landfills and the treatment of wastewater, while the latter was also the main source of N2O emission [nitrous oxide]," he stresses in the document. DSPA clarifies, regarding the tendency of GHG emissions, that "after reaching the peak in 2017, local Emissions of GHG showed a decreasing tendency, year after year, having reached its lower value during the pandemic." However, with the recovery of economic activities and the great movement of people, especially "in the last two years, the estimated emissions of these gases has gradually rise again." The air we breathe Also as regards air quality data is not encouraging, because in 2024 “the number of days with the average quality of the air classified as 'Moderate' registered in the six Macao air quality monitoring stations reached 88 percent, slightly lower than 2023”. There was, in a total of the year, 15 to 34 days with “unhealthy” classification, and only two days obtained the classification of “very unhealthy”. According to DSPA, “the pollutants detected in the air monitoring stations were mainly ozone (O3) and thin particles suspended (PM2.5)”, while “at Berma da Estrada station (Ká-Hó), the highest index detected all year round, classified as 'very unhealthy', was the O3 the main pollutant”. Last year, July was the best air quality month, while October to December obtained the worst qualification according to data from Macao air monitoring stations. The report also reveals that “in terms of compliance with atmospheric pollutant concentrations in 2024, the average annual concentrations of PM10 and PM2.5 registered in the various monitoring stations were lower than the standard values”, while “the average annual concentrations of nitrogen dioxide (NO2) were also below standard values, except for the stem station station. (Macao) and at the High Density Areas station (Macau) ”. More optimistic data is also revealed “daily averages of sulfur dioxide concentrations (SO2) and the maximum averages of eight hours of carbon monoxide concentrations (CO) verified in the various stations throughout the year”, as “both were below standard values”. “In all seasons there was a record of the maximum averages of eight hours of O3 concentrations to exceed standard values ​​in some days. In relation to atmospheric pollutant concentrations recorded in the monitoring stations, generally the average annual concentrations of PM2.5 and NO2, while PM10 and CO descended”, and “as in the road station season (Macao) Only in 2024 did SO2 and O3 begin to be monitored, no comparisons were made. ”

item.title: Cooperation | A look at the approach to Spanish -speaking countries
item.description:
The MSAR was already approaching Spain, but the chief executive began to refer to official speeches the importance of cooperation between Macao and Spanish -speaking countries, as well as the usual Lusophone world. Analysts relate these words to the current panorama of relations between China and Spain
The chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, has expressed in some discourses the importance of having to establish economic and commercial relations not only with Portuguese -speaking countries, but also with Spanish -speaking ones. Last month, on a public occasion, the government leader stated that the territory has to "welcome foreign friends to invest in Macau and also to realize his dreams in Macao." Sam Hou Fai highlighted the area of ​​advanced technology, stressing that “they can come from Portuguese and Spanish-speaking countries” because “as long as they are in favor of economic diversification, they are always welcome,” he added. Moreover, after the inauguration of the new government, Tai Kin IP, secretary for the economy and finance, made, in March, a visit to several European countries, leading a delegation that passed through Spain, Portugal, Belgium and Monaco to deepen “international links and explore opportunities for cooperation”, according to official information released at the time. This approach to the Spanish -language universe, in addition to the usual connection already established between China and the Lusophone world, can have several origins: the growing relationship between China and Spain, as well as the desire to diversify the economy by MSAR, say analysts contacted by HM. “The interpretation of Sam Hou Fai Declaration is very objective and pragmatic and can be summed up to the Macao economy diversification project, for which companies and investors are not only in Macao, but also from Portuguese-speaking countries. But the fact is that companies and institutions in Portuguese-speaking countries are not being effective in response to this need for Macao. For cooperation it seems logical to me, ”said economist Maria Fernanda Ilhéu, former resident of Macao and president of the Friends Association of the New Seda Route (ARS). According to the leader, “Macau is a pure market economy, is classified by the World Trade Organization as a free port with its own international agreements both in the economic, commercial, investment, financial, health, sports, sports, international relations agreements with various organizations. Therefore, the business in Macau is very free, and the part of the government of Macau is to promote and frame this opening”. "As Sam Hou Fai says, all companies and investors who bring Macao economy diversification solutions are welcome," he added. To Cátia Miriam Costa, professor at ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, and specialist in Chinese foreign policy and Macao, considered the HM that “this connection to the Spanish stems from the high -level official visits made by the Spanish government to China, that is, there is certainly one of the consequences of the repeated presence of Spanish diplomacy on a very high level, reinforcing the ties between the two. countries ”. THE IMPORTANCE OF GLOBAL SOUTH It is true that Beijing, in the words of President XI Jinping, has shown great interest in the approach of the countries of the so -called “global south”, where Portuguese and Spanish speaks, essentially. For Cátia Miriam Costa, here also resides another explanation for the change of paradigm in the field of commercial and economic cooperation. "It seems to me that recent meetings with high Spanish political representatives have influenced this decision, along with China's increasing political investment in the global south where Portuguese and Spanish are, in fact, the most spoken languages." For Académica, "the strategy of using Macau as a convergence point may be historically justified by its cosmopolitanism, but also by its traditional role in including the routes that connected Asia to Latin America." In addition, "adds to a historical perspective, a contemporary view for a region that needs economic diversification and benefits from this proximity to distant spaces, whether historical or culturally." Cátia Miriam Costa understands, therefore, that "Spanish can be seen as an additional value to Portuguese, without distorting the paradiplomacy strategy defined for Macao early on." The inclusion of Equatorial Guinea in the Macao Forum cannot be ignored, as a result of its entry to the CPLP - community of Portuguese -speaking countries. However, Cátia Miriam Costa believes that this change has little or nothing to do with the inclusion of Spanish -speaking countries in the official commercial approach discourse. "The inclusion of Equatorial Guinea in the Macao Forum stems from another circumstance, that of his participation as a member of the CPLP. In this sense, it was a logical step in the dynamics of the Forum. However and although it can count as a positive element in this approach, the leverage that Equatorial Guinea has in the Hispanic or Hispanic speaking world," he pointed out. ASES BY ARE Maria Fernanda Ilhéu also highlighted the fact that the only direct air connection between Macao and Europe will be for Madrid and not to Lisbon. “By chance, TAP or the Portuguese government have contacted Air Macau or the Macao government expressing interest in resuming this airline? I don't know, but I know that this connection will greatly contribute to strengthening the Spanish presence in Macao, whether in tourism, commerce or investment.” The guardian highlights the complementarity factor of the air route. "Is the Portuguese and Spanish presence in Macau is incompatible? It doesn't look like, but it is competitive, it may even be beneficial if they know how to collaborate and gain scale in the Great Bay area, but Portugal has to strive more to their presence in Macau is not a historic relic." Moreover, the economist does not forget the role that Portuguese foreign policy may play in this issue, with the removal of Huawei in Portugal and a closer approach to Beijing in recent times. “Portugal's decision banning the use of Huawei equipment says mainly respect for the economic relations of Portugal with mainland China and it is framed by a fearful diplomatic relationship that the Portuguese government followed from 2019 to 2024, contrary to the Spanish diplomatic relationship. It should be noted that the Spanish Prime Minister visited China several times during this period and the Portuguese government alone was represented by the foreign business minister. At the Boao Forum in Hainan, with a brief pass for Beijing. ” Thus, Maria Fernanda Ilhéu understands that between 2019 and 2024 “the Portuguese government and the Portuguese civil society were very conditioned by the American narrative of cold war and the formation of two antagonistic blocks, not knowing how to keep the line followed by 2019 to proceed with a relationship with China supported by the friendship and confidence of nearly 500 years of cooperation in Macau”. The necessary work For the economist and president of ANSRs, it is necessary to take into account the investments and business movements made in recent times to perceive the position of Portugal and Spain in this domain. “The last major investment of a large Chinese company in Portugal was registered in 2020, and only now is this type of investment with Calb investment [SINE Battery producer] that is in the implementation and licensing phase. If we see the same type of investments in Spain from 2020 to 2024 we can record five major energy investments, by China Three Gorges and Huadian; Transport, Geely, Chery Auto and Envision Group; a major investment in agriculture by Yankuang Beijing Energy and also a major investment in the health sector by Worg Pharmaceuticals. ” For the official, “a lot of work will have to be done by the new Portuguese government to develop Portuguese economic cooperation with mainland China and MSAR, but it will also have to be accompanied by Portuguese business fabric,” he said.

item.title: Birth Subsidy | 940 patacas increases
item.description: The birth allowance of civil servants will increase to 6,580 patacas, a growth of 940 patacas, according to the proposal to change the Statute of Public Administration Workers of Macao and related diplomas that is being analyzed by the 2nd Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly. The change was presented yesterday by Chan Chak Mo, deputy and chairman of the commission, who explained that with this proposal the allowance that is currently 60 points, equivalent to 5,640 patacas, will rise to 70 points, which represents a rise of 940 patacas. Quoted by the newspaper or Mun, the deputy pointed out that the law proposal also suggests that medical certificates have to be issued by hospitals, health centers, health posts or medical entities with protocols signed with health services. Chan Chak Mo also explained that the government will not allow the presentation of medical certificates issued by private entities, fear fraud and the increased difficulty of supervision.

item.title: AMCM | New loans for trade fell 22% in April
item.description: Last April, more mortgage loans were contracted for housing compared to March, while new commercial loans for real estate activities fell, according to statistics released yesterday by the Monetary Authority of Macao (AMCM). One of the largest variations was found in commercial loans for real estate activities, which decreased 22.1 percent in April, against March, to a total of 1.52 billion patacas. Of these loans, those granted to MSAR residents were the ones that registered the highest monthly break, reducing 45.6 percent in the month under analysis, to a total of 1.01 billion patacas. It should be noted that the resident segment represents about two thirds of all commercial loans, a much more balanced proportion than in housing loans. In the month under analysis, new housing loans rose a monthly 13.8 percent for a total amount of 883.28 million patacas. Analyzing in the quarter between February and April, the average monthly number of new housing loans fell 15.7 percent compared to the period between January and March. At the end of April, the poorly linked credit credit remained 3.6 percent, the same March, corresponding to an increase of 0.1 percent compared to April 2024. The rally credit in commercial loans reached 5.5 percent, increasing 0.1 percent compared to March this year, and rising 2.1 percent in annual terms.

item.title: Elections | Confirmed exclusion from the list of mutual grassroots aid
item.description:
The 14 seats in the Legislative Assembly chosen by direct suffrage will be discussed by eight lists, the lowest number ever on the MSAR. Caeal considers that authorities' operations against the potential list of Wong Wai Man took place within the attributed skills, but refuses to comment on electoral interference
Legislative elections with fewer lists to participate in direct suffrage since the creation of the MSAR. This is the reality of the elections of September 14, confirmed yesterday by the Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal), and the number of lists can still shrink, depending on any vetoes of candidates by the State Security Defense Commission. According to Caeal, eight candidacy commissions were approved in the direct suffrage that have to deliver until Thursday next week (June 26) the list of candidates and the political program. CAEAL has confirmed that the list application commission helps Mutual Grassroots, linked to the “MAO Soldier”, did not gather the signatures necessary to be constituted and participate in the elections. However, the president of Caeal, Judge Seng Ioi Man, refused to confirm that the list was aimed at an operation of the Commissioner Against Corruption (CCAC) for corruption in the collection of signatures due to "the secrecy of justice." Members of the Potential List Association Association Mutual Help Grassroots were targeted by two police operations last week when they tried to gather the missing signatures to participate in the elections. After delivering the required signatures, Caeal, at first, refused several signatures because they considered that they were duplicated or did not meet legal requirements. Given the invalid signatures, the potential list had an extra five business days to correct the failures. However, over the time, it was the target of two authorities' operations. The first operation aimed at the most media member and head-to-head in 2017 for mutual aid Grassroots, Wong Wai Man, also known as “Soldier of Mao” and “Captain of Macao”. Wong is indicted for illegally exploiting a Mahjong space. The day after the first operation, other members of the association were the target of a CCAC Rusga, for alleged corruption in the subscription collection. Both operations will have left the list without the possibility of submitting the new signatures. Within skills Asked about the impact of authorities' operations on subscription collection aid mutual grassroots and a possible interference in the elections, Seng Ioi Man refused to make any association of police operations with the list. However, he argued that the police action took place within the legally foreseen competences: “Regarding the follow -up work and investigative operations that the police or investigative bodies are performing, our commission will not comment,” began by answering Seng Ioi Man. “Police bodies do their work within their competences and only within these skills receive complaints and do the work. He added. Regarding the fact that the electoral act only has eight lists, and there is a possibility of exclusions by the State Security Defense Commission, the president of Caeal replied that the work was done in accordance with the legislation in force and that guarantee the principle “Macao governed by patriots”. Seng Ioi Man also pointed out that the deputies who were elected have to "love Macau and love our country." Falling lists The eight approved candidacy committees are: Union for Development (linked to the Association of Workers), Promoting Union for Progress (Association of Residents), Macao United Citizens Association (Fujian Community), Synergy Power (Ron Lam), Bom Lar's Alliance (Association of Women), Macau-Guangdong Community (Jiangmen Community) from popular Liveliod in Macau. Only this last commission is not linked to any elected deputy. This year's elections thus contrast with previous years, since for the first time there are less than 10 candidate lists in direct suffrage. Until this edition, the lowest participation had happened in 2001, the first elections after the establishment of the MSAR, when there was a total of 15 lists. At the opposite pole, 2017 was the most participating with 25 lists, a number that fell to 14 lists in 2021, in the first year there was a political exclusion of candidates. After presenting the list of candidates and political programs, the lists still need to go through the political sieve of the State Security Defense Commission. Regarding the indirect suffrage six candidacy commissions were approved.

item.title: IAS | New drugs are 16% of positive tests
item.description:
The Institute of Social Action believes that last year there were 148 drug consumers, about 0.02 percent of the population, based on the number of people who are serving time for consumption or who is in rehabilitation. Still, the 148 consumers represent an increase of 25 percent compared to 2023
The Institute of Social Action has once again betting on a pilot project to test the use of new drugs, such as ethomyidate (known as Space Oil), metcatinone and synthetic cannabinoids. Last year, authorities collected about 1,600 samples that revealed a positivity rate of 9 percent. Among the positive tests, 16 percent concerned the new drugs referred to, Cheang Io Tat, head of the IAS department of dependence on the game and drug, in statements quoted by TDM's Macao channel. Despite the media and stresses provoked by Space Oil, which even led to the amendment of the law, the IAS responsible states that the “traditional drugs” continue to be predominant. Cheang Io Tat spoke on Saturday on the sidelines of the launch of a series of IAS organized activities to mark International Day against Drug Abuse and Trafficking. During the ceremony, IAS delivered “diplomas of recognition to schools that have participated in the Sadia Life Education course over the years, as a way of thanking their contribution to the promotion of the education of healthy life. In addition, the same day was the inauguration ceremony of the scientific exposure on the fight against the Great Bay, performed for the first time this year”. Fantasy world The United Nations Office against Drugs and Crime published in October the World Drug Report that indicated that in 2022, there were almost 292 million consumers of narcoty around the world, about 1 in 18 people. The number advanced by the United Nations pointed to a proportion of about 5.5 percent of the world population that had consumed drugs in the year under analysis. The percentage at the global level is sprayed by the numbers advanced by the Institute of Social Action (IAS), which last year indicated that last year the number of consumers in Macau was 148, or about 0.02 percent of the population of MSAR. In a highly punitive panorama, which pushes pathological or occasional consumers for obscurity, which authorities call “hidden consumption”, IAS numbers represent the only people who in Macao for certainty do not consume drugs: those who are serving time for use or are in rehab. Despite the statistics that do not reflect reality, the authorities indicate that the 148 drug consumers last year represented an increase of about 25 percent compared to 2023. However, the 2024 record was 6 percent lower compared to the period before the pandemic.
